Animate hydrograph

Source: R/plot.R
gr_animate.Rd

A convenient wrapper around gganimate::animate() to animate river hydrograph through years.

Usage

gr_animate(
  df,
  plot = TRUE,
  file = NULL,
  fps = 20,
  kframes = 10,
  width = 800,
  height = 600
)

Arguments

df

data.frame with date (1st) and discharge (2nd) columns.

plot

Boolean. Plot the animation in the viewer? Defaults to TRUE.

file

Character string path to the output file.

fps

Integer value of the frames per second. Defaults to 20.

kframes

Integer value setting how many frames are interpolated between the year. Defaults to 10, which means that if fps = 20, then two years are passed each second.

width

Integer width of the animation (in pixels). Defaults to 800.

height

Integer height of the animation (in pixels). Defaults to 600

Value

The return value of the gganimate::animate() function

Examples

if (require("gganimate") && require("transformr") && require("gifski") && require("png")) {
  
  library(grwat)
  
  # example Spas-Zagorye data is included with grwat package
  data(spas)
  head(spas)
  
  # select years if needed
  df = spas[spas$Date < as.Date('1960-01-01'), ]
  
  # animate
  gr_animate(df)
  
}
#> Loading required package: gganimate
#> Loading required package: ggplot2
#> Loading required package: transformr
#> Loading required package: gifski
#> Loading required package: png
